descript.abstract: This layer contains point locations for each of the Metropolitan Council's rain gauge sites (existing and previous).
descript.purpose: To show the general location of rain gauge sites.
descript.supplinf: East-central Minnesota. Coverage is primarily centered on Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, but the coverage also includes MCES monitoring sites in the Minnesota River Watershed near Mankato and sites along the Mississippi River down to Lake Pepin.

timeperd.current: Dataset shows all rain gauge sites, historical and active, as of the Time Period of Content date.

place.placekey: Minnesota, Twin Cities, Mississippi River, Minnesota River, St. Croix River, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

theme.themekey: rain, water resources rain gauge precipitation

browse.browsed: Sample map showing the MCES Rain Gauge Sites layer.

dataqual.complete: All Metropolitan Council rain gauge sites are included as of 2/13/2007.

procstep.procdesc:
Original Publication: 3/21/2002
MCES rain gauges are typically located adjacent to MCES infrastructure elements such as lift stations, interceptor meters, and wastewater treatment plants. Rain gauges were GPSed in 2005 and 2006 using Trimble GeoXT units with 3 ot 5 meter accuracy.

overview.eaover:
SITE_ID: A unique short code for the rain gauge
SITE_NAME: A short name for the monitoring site.
STATUS: Status of a rain gauge (Active or Removed)
SITE_DESCR: A longer description of the monitoring site.
CITY: The city in which the rain gauge is located.
MAJ_NAME: The name of the major watershed within which the rain gauge is located.
SEC_NAME: The name of the secondary watershed within which the rain gauge is located.
ADDRESS: Interceptor Services given address for rain gauge.
COUNTY: County in which the rain gauge is located.
UNIQUE_ID: 7-digit unique number given to some rain gauges to be used for linking to current interceptor_points shapefile.
MCES_INT: Closest MCES Interceptor to the rain gauge.
WWTP: Closest MCES waste water treatment plant to the rain gauge.
GPS: Was the rain gauge located with GPS equipment? (Y or N)
GPS_X: The x-coordinate of the monitoring site in UTM, zone 15, NAD 83,
meters recorded to two decimal places.
GPS_Y: The y-coordinate of the monitoring site in UTM, zone 15, NAD 83, meters recorded to two decimal places.

You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.
